messages: 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:16): I don't see where RFC 20 was mentioned
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:23): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: In the latest message to the "Issue 101: us-ascii-ref - Straw Poll for Objections" thread.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:23): He linked http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc0020.txt

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:25): Sigh.  Okay, the fancy ascii table formatting is pretty, but really, what's the point of doing something where you have to split up the hexits when you can just do a simple two-column table?  A split 2col table could be equally compact, or likely more compact actually.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:25): Silly people from 40 years ago.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:26): Or I guess 10 years ago, maybe?  When it was put into the archives?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:27): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: was this on public-html? I don't see it...
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:27): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Yeah, it's the thread you started.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:28): If the archive is working again
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:28): What's the purpose of the /mid/ thing, when you can just dive into the individual directories for each list?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:31): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: hmm, oddly I don't see it in my public-html folder
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:31): checking if it might be somewhere else
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:31): You been auto-spamming Leif's email?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:31): Maybe 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c has started snaking on email in the night
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:31): offhand, I am not sure what to do about it, unless someone seriously wants to propose it as an alternative instead of the ones already on the table
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:32): Well, it's an official-looking and seemingly complete ASCII ref.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:32): And it was written by Vint Cerf!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:33): hard to argue with that
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:34): is it in any way superior to the suggested ECMA-006?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:34): my recollection from the poll is that the main objection to 006 is not defining the mapping to unicode, which flaw RFC20 seems to share
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:34): More official-looking.  Otherwise, no, because it lacks the unicode mapping.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:35): I suspect it's actually less official
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:36): Actual officialness is irrelevant.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:36): ECMA-006 is the ECMA version of the joint publication with ISO that is the successor to ASCII
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:36): so it's an official joint publication, not just an ad-hoc copy
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:36): at least as I understand it
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:36): yeah, it's just an RFC
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:37): though really this is all quite nutty
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:37): and quite the time sink
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:37): Man, Cerf really liked his joke RFCs.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (19:37): if we just let the poll continue then mainly it will consume the chairs' time and not much more of anyone else's
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:38): the number of times this issue has been discussed here on IRC and on the list...
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:38): anyway, back to super mario
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:45): kickin' it old school
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:45): is wondering how desperate he should be for MG2
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:45): bros wii that is
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:45): mg2 is quite cool
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (19:45): but some frustrating levels made me give up for now
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Aww, want it for your birthday?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:46): Mario Galaxy + Yoshi sounds like it has to be awesome
